attributes.action: Any ‘peoples vote’ should only have leave options. With or without a deal
attributes.additional_details: Any option to undo the previous result which has failed to be implemented would be undemocratic. We have had enough votes on voting whether to leave or not, whether it was the referendum or the general election. Mps made it law to implement leave and have voted several times on the manner on which this should happen. If Mps want the people to have a vote, it should only be on the manner in which we leave. With a deal or without a deal (no deal).
attributes.background: As a leave/ remain vote has already been decided, mandated but not yet implemented. Any further vote on brexit should only be down to leave options. That is whether we leave with a deal or without a deal, essentially ‘May’s deal’ or no deal. The people already decided whether to leave or not
